start.speaker: Sera
start.text:
Light is not gentle. It burns rot away—and sometimes it burns what the rot was hiding behind.

If you want me with you, don’t ask for comfort. Ask for truth.

choices.text: Then come. I’ll take truth over comfort.
I’m not ready for that kind of truth.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Sera’s calm is not softness. It’s discipline—practiced until it stopped trembling.
